author: nero_eth
content:
One thing we need to discuss today is adding bal_indices for everything that is not modified (storage reads or account access through CALL, BALANCE, etc.).
The question is, when it comes to parallelizing, do clients pass the BAL with the relevant entries + ALL read entries to each process or would it make things simpler/more efficient if the read entries would come with indices too such that clients would only need to pass the relevant write and read entries to each process.
Read indices don't give us any other advantage, afaict.

author: nero_eth
content:
I did some analysis and it would increase the compressed BAL size by ~2%.
I've also put it into the EELS to have the code ready in case:
https://github.com/fselmo/execution-specs/compare/feat/amsterdam-fork-and-block-access-lists...nerolation:execution-specs:add-read_indices?expand=1
